citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"64baac6d-cd7f-4f97-93cf-aecd26911962\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Ce Sea-Bird Thermosalinograph SeaKeeper (SN 17) a \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 le 2018-11-22 au Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route. Cette route de traversier relie le terminal de Horseshoe Bay \u00e0 West Vancouver, en BC, et le terminal de Departure Bay, \u00e0 Nanaimo, en BC. Cet instrument est un Thermosalinographe. Les thermosalinographies recueillent des donn\u00e9es sur la surface de la mer au moyen de syst\u00e8mes d'\u00e9coulement qui se d\u00e9placent au-dessus de l'eau \u00e0 bord d'un navire. Souvent, ils sont mont\u00e9s pr\u00e8s de l'avant du navire afin de minimiser la contamination. Les principales variables mesur\u00e9es sont la temp\u00e9rature et la conductivit\u00e9, et d'autres variables comme la salinit\u00e9 et la densit\u00e9 sont d\u00e9riv\u00e9es. Il a \u00e9t\u00e9 deploy\u00e9 sur une plateforme mouill\u00e9. Les donn\u00e9es de ce d\u00e9ploiement sont archiv\u00e9es et accessibles sur l\u2019infrastructure num\u00e9rique Oceans 3.0 du R\u00e9seau Canadien des Oc\u00e9ans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualit\u00e9 et produits d\u00e9riv\u00e9s selon les conventions \u00e9tablies.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route Thermosalinographe d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 2018-11-22\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/64baac6d-cd7f-4f97-93cf-aecd26911962?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"64baac6d-cd7f-4f97-93cf-aecd26911962\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The Sea-Bird Thermosalinograph SeaKeeper (SN 17) was deployed on 2018-11-22 on Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Horseshoe Bay terminal in West Vancouver, BC and the Departure Bay terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Thermosalinograph. Thermosalinographs collect data from the sea surface via flow-through systems on vessels. Typically they are mounted near the front of the vessel in order to minimize contamination. Primary variables measured are temperature and conductivity, and other variables like salinity and density are derived. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route Thermosalinograph Deployed 2018-11-22\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/64baac6d-cd7f-4f97-93cf-aecd26911962?local=en\"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The Sea-Bird Thermosalinograph SeaKeeper (SN 17) was deployed on 2018-11-22 on Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Horseshoe Bay terminal in West Vancouver, BC and the Departure Bay terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Thermosalinograph. Thermosalinographs collect data from the sea surface via flow-through systems on vessels. Typically they are mounted near the front of the vessel in order to minimize contamination. Primary variables measured are temperature and conductivity, and other variables like salinity and density are derived. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="fra">Ce Sea-Bird Thermosalinograph SeaKeeper (SN 17) a été déployé le 2018-11-22 au Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route. Cette route de traversier relie le terminal de Horseshoe Bay à West Vancouver, en BC, et le terminal de Departure Bay, à Nanaimo, en BC. Cet instrument est un Thermosalinographe. Les thermosalinographies recueillent des données sur la surface de la mer au moyen de systèmes d'écoulement qui se déplacent au-dessus de l'eau à bord d'un navire. Souvent, ils sont montés près de l'avant du navire afin de minimiser la contamination. Les principales variables mesurées sont la température et la conductivité, et d'autres variables comme la salinité et la densité sont dérivées. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme mouillé. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>

        <gco:CharacterString>Previous metadata record [abstract: English = The Sea-Bird Thermosalinograph SeaKeeper (SN 17) was deployed on 2018-11-22 on Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Horseshoe Bay terminal in West Vancouver, BC and the Departure Bay terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Thermosalinograph. Thermosalinographs collect data from the sea surface via flow-through systems on vessels. Typically they are mounted near the front of the vessel in order to minimize contamination. Primary variables measured are temperature and conductivity, and other variables like salinity and density are derived. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = Ce Sea-Bird Thermosalinograph SeaKeeper (SN 17) a été déployé le 2018-11-22 au Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route. Cette route de traversier relie le terminal de Horseshoe Bay à West Vancouver, en BC, et le terminal de Departure Bay, à Nanaimo, en BC. Cet instrument est un Thermosalinographe.           </mac:type>
          <mac:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>A themosalinograph. It is designed for shipboard determination of sea surface pumped-water conductivity and temperature. It can measure temperature in a range from -5 deg C to +35 deg C and conductivity from 0 S/m to 7 S/m. The SeaKeeper uses the same same temperature conductivity sensors used in the SBE 21 Thermosalinograph, but has improved acquisition electronics that increase accuracy and resolution, and lower power consumption. The initial acuracy of the temperature sensor is 0.002 deg C and 0.0003 S/m for conductivity.</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:description>
        </mac:MI_Instrument>

name: 64baac6d-cd7f-4f97-93cf-aecd26911962
notes: The Sea-Bird Thermosalinograph SeaKeeper (SN 17) was deployed on 2018-11-22 on Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Horseshoe Bay terminal in West Vancouver, BC and the Departure Bay terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Thermosalinograph. Thermosalinographs collect data from the sea surface via flow-through systems on vessels. Typically they are mounted near the front of the vessel in order to minimize contamination. Primary variables measured are temperature and conductivity, and other variables like salinity and density are derived. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.

notes_translated.fr: Ce Sea-Bird Thermosalinograph SeaKeeper (SN 17) a été déployé le 2018-11-22 au Horseshoe Bay - Departure Bay Ferry Route. Cette route de traversier relie le terminal de Horseshoe Bay à West Vancouver, en BC, et le terminal de Departure Bay, à Nanaimo, en BC. Cet instrument est un Thermosalinographe. Les thermosalinographies recueillent des données sur la surface de la mer au moyen de systèmes d'écoulement qui se déplacent au-dessus de l'eau à bord d'un navire. Souvent, ils sont montés près de l'avant du navire afin de minimiser la contamination. Les principales variables mesurées sont la température et la conductivité, et d'autres variables comme la salinité et la densité sont dérivées. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme mouillé. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.
